config.question: Subsidies to railroads were different from subsidies to other carriers like canals, highways, and airlines because Congress __________.

choices.content: did not get any financial returns in case of railroad subsidies
exacted specific benefits in exchange for railroad subsidies
added the subsidized amount to the railroads’ passenger fare
subsidized only those railroads that carried passengers

answer_3.response: Consider This: Federal grants stimulated railroad building across the rugged, unsettled West, where the railroads’ revenues would not repay their construction for years. The grants seemed necessary in a nation that, unlike most of Europe, expected private enterprise to build the railroads. See L.O. 18.1 What enabled the United States to build an industrial economy?
